properties.name: Esri
properties.bullet1: Provide world-class technical support to clients developing custom apps using Esri’s ArcGIS software stack
properties.bullet2: Work well in a high energy, fast paced, and collaborative environment
properties.bullet3: Identify, understand, and articulate solutions for customers through oral and written communication
properties.bullet4: Present ArcGIS SDKs and APIs at conferences and hackathons
properties.bullet5: Diagnose, evaluate, and document software bugs and enhancements
properties.bullet6: Train new analysts in the ArcGIS API for JavaScript and AppStudio for ArcGIS
properties.bullet7: Develop new JavaScript and AppStudio samples and documentation
properties.bullet8: Write internal and external technical and creative blog posts

properties.name: Pima
properties.alias: Pima County Community Development and Neighborhood Conservation
properties.bullet1: Developed database of areas targeted for development assistance based on Federal HUD guidelines
properties.bullet2: Edited, analyzed, and mapped socio-economic, demographic, and community asset datasets via ArcMap
properties.bullet3: Prepared a 70-page gazette for consumption by diverse stakeholders

properties.name: Arizona
properties.bullet1: Master’s Project: Explored metropolitan success in the Rust Belt region and the importance of postsecondary education
properties.bullet2: Utilized Esri’s ArcGIS for Desktop software suite

properties.name: DHive
properties.bullet1: Co-created an initiative to bring talented individuals to live in Downtown Detroit
properties.bullet2: Managed Twitter account (2000+ clicks/month), 400-member Facebook group for potential residents

properties.name: UnitedWay
properties.bullet1: Partnered with agencies to plan and lead corporate and student volunteer projects
properties.bullet2: xecuted large days of service, amassing a total of over 6,300 volunteer hours from participants
properties.bullet3: Developed a training program for Team Leaders to conduct smaller volunteer projects

properties.name: Hillel
properties.bullet1: Coordinated with and supported two student leaders to design a new and innovative curriculum around University of Michigan Hillel student’s relationship with Detroit and its residents
properties.bullet2: Planned events, meetings, discussions, and volunteer projects with a complex variety of partners
properties.bullet3: Lead a weeklong alternative spring break trip, managing budget, scheduling, and group morale

properties.name: SitC
properties.bullet1: Assisted with general logistics, hosted groups of volunteers and acted as an ambassador to the city
properties.bullet2: Motivated and built self-esteem in children and volunteers in Project Play, bringing together Metro Detroit high school students and Southwest Detroit elementary school students
properties.bullet3: Explored the importance of volunteering with high school volunteers through informal discussions

properties.name: TRU
properties.bullet1: Conducted research on integrating the M1 Woodward light-rail line with Detroit’s current transit system
properties.bullet2: Compiled a list of recommendations to ensure a socially equitable transit system
properties.bullet3: Advocated for improved transit funding in Metro Detroit and across the state of Michigan

properties.name: MichDNR
properties.bullet1: Developed algorithms to obtain anglers’ trip coordinates, using water-body and city/county data
properties.bullet2: Collaborated with a team from Michigan DNR, University of Michigan, and Michigan State University
properties.bullet3: Used Microsoft Access and ArcGIS for Desktop to manage, create and edit spatial data
